header_summary:
Antoine Poinsot's guidance for Victor on mastering Bitcoin wallet functionalities and Miniscript highlights a structured educational path, beginning with the Bitcoin Core wallet API and extending through practical applications of the BDK library and hardware interface integration. This comprehensive approach is designed to equip Victor with a deep understanding of Bitcoin Script, Miniscript, and the development of robust software for diverse usage scenarios, recommending engagement with projects like Liana or Nunchuk and participation in technical discussion groups for further learning ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/vSl9GmLdknrrpIJWieOlkhLVW7xpRcZyMwZiLX2B7kZsRPcRshjdNU5HphnHZObCNyrdfiY9xhXJ-vhgRs3vTYOjIwSjgXeWaUIOgUhgAvg=@protonmail.com/T/#m47c99d80bf10566e3f97a94f153896e9a244dea7)).

Greg Maxwell and others in the Bitcoin Development community discuss the broader implications of a proposal targeting Bitcoin assets, emphasizing the need for a reevaluation of its potential effects on digital asset holdings, including NFTs. This conversation reflects concerns within the community about the unintended consequences of such proposals on the value and operations of Bitcoin and NFTs ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CAAS2fgR91F1-3HuQ16iVoT9XeyrFXtZ94_t6bWUL0QbLNRVhHw@mail.gmail.com/T/#meac1be08f9bde7d3d515e60521964123b618cc08)).

Murch's analysis of handling "dust-class" UTXOs within the Bitcoin network explores a proposal for a separate sub-mempool for managing these transactions efficiently. This discussion raises critical questions about the practicality and feasibility of such a system, alongside considerations for optimizing network resources and accommodating low-value transactions ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/02d7368e-95d3-4185-b70f-3aa9b5df1e1d@murch.one/T/#m476d073294a90615e43218e5426cf45334b55cb1)).

Lastly, discussions around post-quantum cryptography (PQC) and the integration of Zero-Knowledge (ZK) proofs into blockchain transactions underline the ongoing evolution required in cryptographic practices and the potential to enhance transaction security and flexibility. These conversations emphasize the necessity of continually reassessing and fortifying encryption methodologies in anticipation of advancements in quantum computing and the exploration of novel trust mechanisms through co-signer reputation systems ([source 1](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/shrincs-324-byte-stateful-post-quantum-signatures-with-static-backups/2158/2), [source 2](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/building-a-vault-using-blinded-co-signers/2141/3)).

active_posts.title: Dust Expiry: Clean the UTXO set from spam
active_posts.summary:
- A soft-fork proposes age-based expiration for dust outputs to reduce UTXO set spam.
- The UTXO set doubled in size since 2023, largely due to spam activities.
- The solution allows removing expired UTXOs to decrease the set size, seeking community feedback.
